meanings.definition: Collecting into a mass or group
meanings.sent1: The ants were agglomerating around the sugar cube.
meanings.sent2: The students were agglomerating in the schoolyard before class.
meanings.sent3: The toys seemed to be agglomerating in the toy chest all by themselves!
meanings.sent4: The colorful balloons agglomerated in the sky, creating a beautiful display.
meanings.sent5: The fallen leaves were agglomerating in the corner, forming a crunchy pile.

meanings.definition: Forming into a cluster or aggregation
meanings.sent1: The clouds were agglomerating in the sky, blocking the sun.
meanings.sent2: The data points were agglomerating on the graph, showing a clear trend.
meanings.sent3: The birds were agglomerating on the telephone wire, chirping happily.
meanings.sent4: The stars agglomerated in the night sky, twinkling like diamonds.
meanings.sent5: The ingredients were agglomerating in the mixing bowl, ready to be stirred.
